entry.title: Dual fellowships support Joslyn’s deep dive into neurophysiology

link.title: Dual fellowships support Joslyn’s deep dive into neurophysiology

entry.content:
Joslyn will use our widefield fluorescence optical imaging system and fiber photometry system to understand how adenosine plays a role in brain hemodynamics regulation. Image credit: Tyler Lee.

Joslyn Claypool, an undergraduate research assistant in our lab, recently won two prestigious awards: the 2025 Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship from the American Physiological Society (one of the 12 students internationally) and a research support fellowship from MSU’s College of Natural Science. A double major in neuroscience and psychology, Joslyn is investigating how adenosine, a chemical affected by caffeine, influences brain blood flow and inflammation. To learn more about Joslyn and her research , please read the Student Spotlight article posted by our departmental communication team. Congratulations, Joslyn!
entry.summary: Joslyn will use our widefield fluorescence optical imaging system and fiber photometry system to understand how adenosine plays a role in brain hemodynamics regulation. Image credit: Tyler Lee.

entry.title: First experiment done
entry.content: First thin-skull window and imaging session done all by our trainees themselves.
entry.summary: First thin-skull window and imaging session done all by our trainees themselves.

entry.title: Olivia joins the lab
entry.content: After finishing her rotation in BMS program. Olivia officially joined the Molecular Cellular and Integrative Physiology graduate program and our lab. Welcome Olivia!
entry.summary: After finishing her rotation in BMS program. Olivia officially joined the Molecular Cellular and Integrative Physiology graduate program and our lab. Welcome Olivia!

entry.title: Joslyn receives undergraduate research fellowship
entry.content: Joslyn Claypool, a neuroscience senior and an undergraduate research assistant in our lab, was recently awarded with a research support fellowship from the College of Natural Science. This fellowship will support her research in the lab for the Spring semester. Congrats Joslyn!
entry.summary: Joslyn Claypool, a neuroscience senior and an undergraduate research assistant in our lab, was recently awarded with a research support fellowship from the College of Natural Science. This fellowship will support her research in the lab for the Spring semester. Congrats Joslyn!

entry.title: Nick joins the lab
entry.content: Nick Heelan joined the lab on 8/12/2024 as a research technician. He brings extensive experience in supporting research operations, and we are very grateful to have him join us!
entry.summary: Nick Heelan joined the lab on 8/12/2024 as a research technician. He brings extensive experience in supporting research operations, and we are very grateful to have him join us!

entry.title: Lab Website Goes Up
entry.content:
Welcome to the Zhang Laboratory Website!

We will open our doors on January 1st, 2024 in the Department of Physiology at the Michigan State University. Let me know how it looks and how I can improve it. We will be hiring at all levels soon.
entry.summary: Welcome to the Zhang Laboratory Website!
